item.title: Archbishop Oscar Cruz passes away at 85
item.description: Lingayen-Dagupan Archbishop Emeritus Oscar Cruz has died at age 85, according to the Catholic Bishops Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) on Wednesday.

item.title: Construction jobs will be in demand based on 2021 budget --DOLE
item.description: More jobs in the construction sector will be opened based on the allocation for the Build, Build, Build Program in the proposed 2021 national budget, a Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) official said Wednesday.

item.title: 1,333 more traditional jeepneys allowed to operate in 23 new NCR routes
item.description: Over 1,300 public utility jeepneys are allowed to operate in 23 new routes starting Wednesday, August 26, 2020, according to James Agustin's report on Unang Balita.

item.title: Tuguegarao City reverts to stricter MECQ due to COVID-19 cases
item.description: Cagayan province's capital Tuguegarao City will be reverted to a stricter modified enhanced community quarantine (MECQ) status for nine days due to COVID-19 cases.

item.title: PNP spox says martial law in Sulu could help strengthen anti-terror law
item.description: "We think that imposing limited martial law in Sulu province would in fact enhance the implementation of the anti-terror law...Although we are still awaiting for the IRR to be released by the Anti-Terrorism Council," Police Brigadier General Bernard Banac said Wednesday.

item.title: PhilHealth chief Morales to file resignation letter Wednesday
item.description: Embattled PhilHealth president and CEO Ricardo Morales on Wednesday said he would file his resignation within the day, two days after President Rodrigo Duterte reportedly said it would be better for him to quit his post amid his health condition.

item.title: Hillary Clinton to Biden: Don't concede in close election
item.description: Hillary Clinton, who lost to Donald Trump in 2016, said Tuesday that this year's Democratic challenger Joe Biden should refuse to concede until all votes are counted in a tight and possibly drawn-out contest.

item.title: North Korean leader Kim calls for prevention efforts against coronavirus, looming typhoon - report
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has called for prevention efforts against the novel coronavirus and a typhoon, state news agency KCNA said on Tuesday.

item.title: China says US spy plane entered no-fly zone - report
item.description: China said a US spy plane entered a no-fly zone used by the Chinese military for live-fire drills, branding it an act of provocation, state media said Tuesday.

item.title: Wisconsin governor declares state of emergency, Kenosha braces for 3rd night of unrest
item.description: The family of the Black man shot by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin, made an emotional plea for the value of their son's life on Tuesday and called for an end to the violent protests that erupted in the city.

item.title: Global COVID-19 cases reach more than 23.6M, death toll at 813,733 with more than 15M recoveries
item.description: At least 23,689,860 cases have been registered. Of these, at least 15,098,600 are now considered recovered and at least 813,733 people have died since the outbreak emerged in China last December, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Tuesday.

item.title: At least 13 bodies pulled from rubble of collapsed Indian building
item.description: At least 13 people have been killed and several are still missing after a residential building collapsed in western India, where a rescue operation has been under way for more than 28 hours, officials said on Tuesday.

item.title: WHO declares Africa free of polio
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday declared that Africa was free of the virus that causes polio, a landmark in a decades-long campaign to eradicate the notorious disease around the world.

item.title: Duterte's wish for Morales the 'humanitarian way' to say 'you're fired' -Sotto
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte's wish for Philippine Health Insurance Corp. president Ricardo Morales to resign for health reasons is the "humanitarian way" of sacking the state insurer's top executive, Senate President Vicente Sotto III said on Tuesday.

item.title: UST teases virtual campus tour
item.description: With the traffic on campus limited due to the ongoing coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic, students of the centuries-old university came up with the UST Minecraft Campus Tour.
